lx4p

Class LXPTextField

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXPTextField

  • public class LXPTextField
extends java.lang.Object
    LXPTextField is a member of a LXPTextGroup it highlights when the cursor hovers over it When clicked, it requests the LXPTextGroup select its station to receive keyPressed messages Other key presses are added to the fields value string which is displayed, up to the fields maximum number of characters. Pressing the delete key clears the value Pressing the left arrow removes the last character When tab, return, or enter are pressed, the TextGroup is notified

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet p)
      draws the text field, showing a change when the mouse is over the field and when the field has focus to receive key presses.
      void keyPressed(processing.core.PApplet p)
      called when a key is pressed and the field's text group has selected this field to receive the press
      void mousePressed()
      called from the LXPTextGroup's mousePressed method if the mouse is over the field, sets the key focus of the group

        xp - x location in Processing Applet window

        s - the number of characters allowed
